title: Are there really no rules against Smurfing?
body: Seems completely unfair, but if so I may as well join the party! Time to have some fun in Bronze ;)

replies.body:
It's frowned upon, and you aren't allowed to deliberately lose in order to play at lower elo.

If you want to smurf you have to level up a brand new account.
Honestly I don't recommend it. Sure the idea of "smashing bronzies" is "fun", but have you ever actually witnessed a real bronze match?
It's in no way "fun" you get Sion's building {{item:3085}}  Ahri's taking a {{item:3153}}  and Lulus "counterpicking" Riven in top lane.

I've been smurfing quite a bit from Bronze V - Bronze I recently and I haven't seen anything that bad.
Holy poop, if that's what really happens in bronze I'm so screwed when I hit 30 -_-
It's best if you don't enter ranked as soon as you hit 30. You need to increase your champion pool, and get some decent rune pages set up, as well as learning every roll.

Yeah I know. The champion pool thing I'm working on. I'm already fairly confident in every role so just need to practice the last hitting and stuff (my farm on average is around 5-6 creeps per minute), the rune pages will take me forever to do, but I do have to standard rune pages for AD and AP with tier 3 runes.

1: runaans is literally the best item in the game.
2: extra kite power on a kite mage? hardly a bad idea...extra damage to towers, extra slow, extra attack speed.
3: lulu WAS the counterpick vs riven when lulu was one of the strongest mage tops...i dont....what?

not really, runaans is the coolest designed item in the game, sure it does nothing for sion, but really...its counterpart is hydra...one of the best items on sion.
AD ahri actually is ok, esp now with her added kite power.
and 3rd one is flat out truth. no idea why she stopped being even considered a counter to riven....she still has the CC to stop and lock down riven and she is a great top laner. and ult = denial of riven ult execute.

AD Ahri yes, a BOTRK is okay, but not on a full AP Ahri.

And no, I've never once seen a Lulu outside of the pro-league beat a Riven in top lane.

Smurfing in itself isn't against any rules, however all the same rules apply regardless of whether you're using a smurf account or not. Generally certain people claim to be on smurfs for high elo accounts (usually not smurfs or smurfs of low elo accounts) and give the smurf community a bad name, a few sour apples ruin the bunch basically. The only way using smurf accounts becomes "unfair" is when the person using it breaks the rules.

I used to have a "smurf" (really just another account I played on) back when LeaverBuster imposed bans rather than Low Priority Queues. Whenever my main account got banned, which happened a lot due to the fact that my parents didn't understand that you can't just pause a game of League, I played on the other one. Then Riot screwed that idea over with the low priority queues.

> really just another account I played on

That's pretty much all a smurf is.
Yeah, but I only got to lvl 13 on it xD Still haven't hit lvl 30 on any account yet but I'm close with this one
